NICE Community Schools Breaks Ground on Aspen Ridge Addition
By Samuel McKnight,
1 days agoISHPEMING, Mich. – Nice Community Schools has begun construction on a major addition to the Aspen Ridge Middle and High School building, a long-anticipated project that includes a new practice gymnasium and two classrooms. “We’re really excited,” Superintendent Bryan DeAugustine said. “We’re building a new practice gym and two...

author: David Griffin
title: 'It's A Blessing' : Salvation Army Provides Shelter For People In Need This Winter
text: Sunday, January 7th 2024, 3:39 pm When the temperature drops, people with nowhere to go feel the impact. “People can pass from freezing to death,” Shawn Burns said. Burns says he knows what being out in the cold is like. “I didn’t have no place to go, I ran low on money paying bills,” he said. Until he came to the Salvation Army's Center for Hope. “Being out in this cold brings your body heat down, but Salvation Army will open those doors for you,” he said. Burns says the Salvation Army has been a warm place to lay his head for the past three months. “I sleep upstairs, I got my own bed,” he said. And somewhere to call home while he gets back on his feet. “I’m going when I get paid on the first…I’m going home,” said Burns. Major Carlyle Gargis with the Salvation Army said year after year, they've provided shelter to those in need without hesitation. “We want to be able to provide a place for them that’s safe and warm and to protect them from the elements outside,” he said. Gargis said whenever there's inclement weather in the area, they see more people seeking shelter. He said the Salvation Army provides people with blankets, a hot shower and a bed to escape the bitter cold temperatures. “We’re always watching the weather here at the Salvation Army, we’re always looking down range,” he said. And while Gargis said they are just doing what they always do… “We love the people that we get to take care of, and we don’t want them to be out,” he said. Burns says that a simple act of kindness and support means more than they know. “It is a blessing because of God…God’s the one that brought them here,” he said. January 7th, 2024 January 7th, 2024 January 7th, 2024 January 7th, 2024 January 7th, 2024 January 7th, 2024 January 7th, 2024

author: Luca Saati
title: Conan Exiles, disponibile l’aggiornamento Age of Heroes
text:
Funcom è entusiasta di rilasciare Age of Heroes per Conan Exiles, il Survival Sandbox open world ambientato nelle terre selvagge di Conan il Barbaro. Questa nuova stagione di aggiornamenti, che inizia oggi con il Capitolo 1, include due nuovissimi personaggi compagni, completamente doppiati, con vantaggi unici e missioni epiche proprie. Inoltre, l’aggiornamento di oggi rinnova completamente i thrall dei lavoratori per creare insediamenti viventi e vivaci per i giocatori.
Incontra uno dei nuovi compagni nel nuovo trailer cinematografico per avere un assaggio della vendetta che alimenta il guerriero Aesir.
Dall’uscita di Age of Sorcery nel 2022, i contenuti di Conan Exiles sono cresciuti in modo significativo, con l’aggiunta della Stregoneria, di nuovi incontri, degli accaparramenti dei clan, dell’assedio di al-Merayah, della costruzione di taverne, delle fatalità e di diverse rielaborazioni importanti o complete del sistema per elementi come il combattimento, il bottino e le epurazioni. Senza contare la montagna di armature cosmetiche, armi, stili di costruzione e altro ancora.
In Age of Heroes, i giocatori emergeranno dalle ceneri della guerra verso una nuova alba. Gli eroi delle Terre Esiliate hanno bisogno di aiuto. Trovateli e affrontate la loro missione per ottenere la loro lealtà. Accompagnandoli nel loro viaggio, questi personaggi completamente doppiati otterranno ciascuno dei vantaggi unici in base alle vostre azioni e decisioni.
La seconda caratteristica principale di Age of Heroes trasforma i thrall dei lavoratori da statici miglioramenti delle postazioni di lavoro in persone vive e vegete, con esigenze e reazioni al mondo che li circonda. La vostra base si trasformerà in una vivace città popolata dai vostri seguaci.
Inoltre, nel negozio di articoli del Bazar è stata aggiunta un’ampia espansione del set di edifici di Argosse, che include un osservatorio splendidamente dettagliato e molti altri oggetti unici, dalle armi e armature dei Pitti alle decorazioni interne.
The Age of Heroes è disponibile da oggi su PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox X|S, Xbox One e Xbox Game Pass.
https://youtu.be/XTI5N7tBlvc
Discutine sul forum

author: @arunrath
title: This multi-instrumentalist wasn’t fully satisfied with the piano. So he designed a new one. | GBH
text: At GBH’s All Things Considered, [Mehmet Ali Sanlikol](https://necmusic.edu/faculty/mehmet-ali-sanlikol) is a regular guest. He’s a composer, singer and multi-instrumentalist — and, as a professor at the New England Conservatory, he has another talent: breaking down complex musical ideas. On Friday, at the Regattabar in Cambridge, Sanlikol is [performing](https://www.regattabarjazz.com/event/mehmet-ali-sanlikol-trio-april-12-2024/) a show with his ensemble that mixes traditional Turkish classical music with Western styles and jazz. He’ll also be debuting two, brand-new musical instruments that were created just for him: a keyboard instrument called ‘The Renaissance 17’ and an electric oud. ‘The Renaissance 17’ doesn’t appear futuristic, or even modern, at first glance. In its wooden housing, it looks more like a harpsichord. But inside, it’s all electronics on the keyboard. What would be the black keys on a piano are split in two, so Sanlikol can play non-Western scales. Host Arun Rath visited Sanlikol in his home studio in Belmont last week for a preview. What follows is a lightly edited transcript of their conversation. Mehmet Ali Sanlikol: I especially wanted to give you examples of the kind of thing that I’ll be playing more at the Regattabar and our upcoming shows, where I actually program my own tuning and temperament schemes based on Ottoman-Turkish modes — microtonal modes. This one is very close to the kind of period tuning that is based on the pure thirds. So, for example, this distance here — D to F-sharp. If I use the key that’s closer to me, then it’s going to be the pure third that’s perfectly in tune. But if I use that one, that’s a G-flat — that’s going to be out of tune. Now this E-flat — the raised one — is going to be in tune with the G. So that E-flat major chord is in perfect third tuning, and here’s the major seven chord, that’s also in perfect tuning. When you start playing makams — like, scalar-wise — now you start getting these intervals that are slightly funky. They’re just a little narrower. These are not exaggerated intervals, but I wanted to start from those that don’t necessarily sound too far out. When I play these chords, they don’t sound microtonal in the way of [Krzysztof] Penderecki, [György] Ligeti, and those kinds of microtonality in them, stemming from the more avant-garde period of Western classical music. This is the kind of tonal alignment and intonation alignment that is more historical and more modal. Arun Rath: What’s striking for me is [that] the regular intervals all sound so pure. It’s like a third — it sounds like a perfect fifth in terms of — Sanlikol: — how beautiful it blends. Rath: For me, I feel it more than I hear it. Sanlikol: Until I conceived, designed and finally got to the point of a fully functional instrument, this world was not necessarily available to me. The more monophonic way of playing it, scale-wise, was available to me on the tambour, etc., but this level of vertical harmonic exploration was not available. “This level of vertical harmonic exploration was not available.”Mehmet Ali Sanlıkol, on why he designed the ‘Renaissance 17’ That’s part of the reason why I wanted to design the Renaissance 17. I was trained as a pianist. I want to be able to play this instrument like [jazz musicians] Chick Corea and Herbie Hancock. I want to be able to do stuff like this. You realize that I’m using my microtonal pitches, right? But I can play it like that, it just requires a little bit of adjustment because of the split keys, but I know where I am on this keyboard. It maintains the traditional layout. I said to myself, “I don’t want to learn a new instrument. This is what I want — I want 17 keys. I want the digital flexibility by way of being able to switch between tunings, patches, etc., and here I am.

author: Román González
title: Prosperidad: estos son los 4 signos zodiacales que serán bendecidos con abundancia y sabiduría desde HOY 31 de mayo, según predicciones | El Heraldo de México
text: En el último día del mes, la Luna Cuarto Menguante irradiará toda su energía cósmica en beneficio de cuatro signos, los cuáles serán bendecidos con abundancia y sabiduría. Vale recordar que por [Astrología](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astrolog%C3%ADaa) se entiende a la disciplina que estudia la posición de los cuerpos celestes. En base a estas observaciones, los astrólogos realizan predicciones sobre los [doce signos del zodiaco.](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zodiaco) LUNA EN CUARTO MENGUANTE Hoy, viernes 31 de mayo de 2024, nos encontramos en la fase lunar de Cuarto Menguante. En esta fase, la Luna se encuentra en su última etapa del ciclo lunar, con aproximadamente un 23% de su superficie iluminada. Durante la noche, podemos observar la mitad derecha del disco lunar iluminado, mientras que la otra mitad se encuentra en sombras. En astrología, la Luna en Cuarto Menguante se asocia con un momento de introspección, cierre y liberación. Es un tiempo para soltar lo que ya no nos sirve, ya sean patrones de pensamiento negativos, hábitos perjudiciales o relaciones tóxicas. SIGNOS ZODIACALES BENEFICIADOS CON LA LUNA MENGUANTE Según los astrólogos, estos son los 4 signos zodiacales que serán bendecidos con abundancia y sabiduría desde HOY 31 de mayo gracias a la Luna Menguante: 1. Aries (21 de marzo al 19 de abril): Momento de gran energía y dinamismo para Aries, donde la intuición y la acción podrían llevarlos a oportunidades inesperadas de abundancia. También se sentirían más sabios y seguros de sí mismos, listos para tomar decisiones acertadas. 2. Leo (23 de julio al 22 de agosto): Período favorable para la prosperidad económica y el crecimiento personal de Leo. La creatividad y el liderazgo podrían verse recompensados, y podrían recibir reconocimientos o ascensos en el trabajo. También se sentirían más intuitivos y conectados con su sabiduría interior. 3. Sagitario (22 de noviembre al 21 de diciembre): La fortuna podría haber sonreído a los Sagitario en el último día de mayo, especialmente en lo relacionado con viajes, estudios o negocios internacionales. También se sentirían más optimistas y con ganas de aprender cosas nuevas, expandiendo su sabiduría y conocimiento. 4. Acuario (20 de enero al 18 de febrero): Un tiempo de innovación y transformación para Acuario, donde la originalidad y las ideas fuera de lo común podrían generar nuevas fuentes de ingresos. También se sentirían más abiertos a nuevas perspectivas y dispuestos a ampliar su conocimiento. SIGUE LEYENDO [Abundancia: estos son los 4 signos zodiacales que serán bañados con prosperidad y paz mental desde HOY 30 de mayo, según predicciones](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/tendencias/2024/5/30/abundancia-estos-son-los-signos-zodiacales-que-seran-banados-con-prosperidad-paz-mental-desde-hoy-30-de-mayo-segun-predicciones-607944.html) [Prosperidad: estos son los 4 signos zodiacales que multiplicarán sus ingresos en los próximos 10 días, gracias a la Luna de Flores](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/tendencias/2024/5/27/prosperidad-estos-son-los-signos-zodiacales-que-multiplicaran-sus-ingresos-en-los-proximos-10-dias-gracias-la-luna-de-flores-606932.html)

author: Xavier Martinage
title: Le yacht de Carlos Ghosn saisi après sa fuite rocambolesque
text: Les images avaient fait le tour du monde fin 2019 : après plusieurs mois de préparation, [Carlos Ghosn](https://www.capital.fr/economie-politique/carlos-ghosn-prive-de-sa-retraite-chapeau-a-775-000-euros-1490981) [fuyait le Japon](https://www.capital.fr/economie-politique/carlos-ghosn-revient-sur-son-incroyable-evasion-dans-une-boite-1409493), alors qu’il était en résidence surveillée, pour retourner [au Liban](https://www.capital.fr/entreprises-marches/la-surprenante-reconversion-de-carlos-ghosn-au-liban-1440639). Soupçonné notamment d’abus de bien sociaux et de malversations financières par la [justice japonaise](https://www.capital.fr/entreprises-marches/la-tres-lourde-peine-de-prison-que-risque-maintenant-carlos-ghosn-1317132), l’ancien patron de Renault-Nissan a toujours soutenu que les anciens patrons de [Nissan](https://www.capital.fr/auto/carlos-ghosn-des-emails-internes-demontreraient-un-coup-monte-de-nissan-1372842) orchestraient un complot contre lui. Des arguments étayés par ses avocats qui ont sans cesse dénoncé une «enquête extrêmement illégale». Ils dénonçaient aussi la constitution d’une «task-force» dans le but de «lui imputer des fautes et de l'évincer». Depuis, plusieurs procédures ont été ouvertes contre Carlos Ghosn, notamment une concernant un yacht de 37 mètres lui appartenant, expliquaient [Les Echos](https://www.lesechos.fr/industrie-services/automobile/affaire-ghosn-la-bataille-du-yacht-des-caraibes-2119658) le 18 septembre dernier. D’une valeur de dix millions d’euros, le «Shachou» («patron» en japonais) était prisé du couple Ghosn, selon nos confrères. Un petit bijou des mers construit par le groupe italien Ferretti. Un bateau qui faisait d’ailleurs partie de la série des Navetta 37, construite sous sa marque Custom line. Le yacht a changé de nom Mais Nissan a toujours accusé son ancien patron de l’avoir acheté en détournant des fonds et réclamait sa propriété. Plus précisément, le groupe automobile accusait Carlos Ghosn d’avoir puisé dans sa «réserve de PDG» et donc détourné 12 millions de dollars. Au bout de plusieurs années de procédure, le feuilleton a pris fin puisque le 9 août, un juge des Îles Vierges (archipel des Antilles situé entre Anguilla et l'île de Porto Rico connu pour être un paradis fiscal), a décidé de saisir le bateau et donner raison à Nissan. Le groupe japonais va récupérer l’usufruit du yacht qui a depuis changé de nom pour devenir «Twig» («brindille» en français). Une perte pour Carlos Ghosn, bien qu’il ne l’utilisait plus depuis de longs mois déjà…

author: Anthony Robledo
title: Viral photo of forlorn Spiral Hot Dogs owner leads to booming business
text: An Oklahoma hot dog joint owner visibly wanted customers one day and he soon got more than he bargained for.During a slow shift on Dec. 20, a customer took a photo of Scott Hosek standing by his restaurant entrance waiting for diners and shared it on social media. Hosek would soon have no time to stand around as " Spirals: Hot Dogs & More ," in Norman, Oklahoma, saw booming business once the post went viral."We immediately started doing double digits in sales," Hosek told USA TODAY on Thursday. "It happened really fast to me."The day the photo was taken, Hosek found himself staring out the window upset his family business of four years wasn't booming as well as others ahead of Christmas. Hosek said he had no idea why Spirals saw a sudden wave of new customers after Dec. 20 until the person responsible for posting the photo, Nick Chappell, later apologized and offered to take the post down.Hosek wouldn't hear of it."You just wouldn't expect it. Social media is amazing. It's amazing that people get involved with it," he said. "But more importantly, it's the stuff that you just don't think would work. That's what works." 'I will always love you': See Dolly Parton grant Utah man's dying wish to meet her Chappell visited the Norman area for his job as an Oklahoma Army National Guard. As part of their weekly hot dog Wednesday routine, Chappell and a his co-worker found Spirals on Google Maps and took a chance.Noticing Hosek gazing, Chappell decided to capture the "wholesome moment" on Snapchat captioning "He has been standing here waiting on customers to come in.""A good buddy of mine named Chad said, 'Hey, man, you can either post this on Facebook or I'm going to post this on Facebook. Some way or another we're going to get this guy some customers,'" Chappell said.In a Facebook post, Chappell gave an excellent recommendation of the restaurant, complimenting their food and "off the charts" service. He shared a photo of his dish, the menu and of Hosek waiting for diners.Chappell was blown away by the success of the post, which has since had over 2,000 shares, and even more surprised to see over 70 guests at the diner during his next visit."I'm not a huge social media guy I typically don't share," Chappell said. "I don't even know really the words to describe it as but it made me even that much happier that I did make a post."Hosek is showing his gratitude by adding a new item in Chappell's honor. Having named hot dogs and bowls after family members, he was more than happy to do so.The "Thunderbird" is a hot link with bacon, cream cheese and jalapeños, Hosek said. The meal gets its name from the Thunderbird Unit Patch for the 45th Infantry, which Chappell is a part of.The two reconnected at the restaurant on Thursday, where they both got emotional talking about the post's impact.Chappell received a certificate of appreciation during the unveiling of the "Thunderbird" and was told he is now forever part of the Spirals family."To know that it was a humble guy that just saw our need and did what he could. He doesn’t have a real following on social media, he hardly ever shares anything and to know that one post had so much power. It was super cool," Hosek added.
